data.enText: suitable, acceptable or correct for the particular circumstances

data.chText: 恰如其分的反应；恰当的措施 / 方法
现在既已找出问题的症结，即可采取适当行动。
data.enText: Now that the problem has been identified, appropriate action can be taken.

data.chText: 正式聚会上穿牛仔裤不合适。
data.enText: Jeans are not appropriate for a formal party.

data.chText: 这本书的文体适合儿童阅读。
data.enText: The book was written in a style appropriate to the age of the children.

data.chText: 现在发表演讲是不是时候？
data.enText: Is now an appropriate time to make a speech?

data.chText: 请在我的万事达 / 维萨 / 美国运通信用卡账户中扣除（酌情扣除）。
data.enText: Please debit my Mastercard/Visa/American Express card ( delete as appropriate ).

data.chText: 政府未采取恰当的措施回应无家可归者的需要，为此已受到谴责。
data.enText: The government has been accused of not responding appropriately to the needs of the homeless.

data.chText: 人们把这链状火山群很恰当地称作“火环”。
data.enText: The chain of volcanoes is known, appropriately enough , as the ‘Ring of Fire’.
to take sth, sb's ideas, etc. for your own use, especially illegally or without permission

data.chText: 他被控盗用俱乐部资金。
data.enText: He was accused of appropriating club funds.

data.chText: 反对党的一些政策已被政府照搬照用。
data.enText: Some of the opposition party's policies have been appropriated by the government.
to take or give sth, especially money for a particular purpose

data.chText: 已拨款五百万元用于这种疾病的研究。
data.enText: Five million dollars has been appropriated for research into the disease.

simple_means.memory_skill: ap 加强 + propri 拥有 + ate 使… → 强行拥有〔公物〕→ 挪用

ex.enText: Will it be convenient for you to come this afternoon?

ex.chText: 你会发现用信用卡付款非常便利。
ex.enText: You'll find it very convenient to pay by credit card.

ex.chText: 我们必须为这次研讨会安排一个合适的时间和地点。
ex.enText: We must arrange a convenient time and place for the seminar.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人来说很方便的，能省时省力省事的。

ex.enText: The situation is not appropriate for an attack.

ex.chText: 我们希望有一种更切合学生需求的教育制度。
ex.enText: We want an education system that is more appropriate to the needs of the students.

ex.chText: 让他来做这份工作是合适的。
ex.enText: It is appropriate to let him do the job.

synonyms.bx: 指适合某一时间、情况、目的等的，常后接介词 for/to。

ex.chText: 务必把每样东西都放在恰当的位置。
ex.enText: Make sure that everything is in its proper place.

ex.chText: 她穿着适合聚会的服装。
ex.enText: She wore proper clothes for the party.

ex.chText: 你必须知道刷牙的正确方法。
ex.enText: You have to know the proper way to clean your teeth.

synonyms.bx: 指正确而恰当的，侧重于符合某种标准或习惯，用于此义时只作定语。

synonym.guide: 导航词义：方便的，合适的

tr: give or assign a resource to a particular person or cause
example: I will earmark this money for your research
She sets aside time for meditation every day

tr: take possession of by force, as after an invasion
example: the invaders seized the land and property of the inhabitants

tr: suitable for a particular person or place or condition etc
example: a book not appropriate for children
a funeral conducted the appropriate solemnity
it seems that an apology is appropriate

value.boxr_value: The adjective is pronounced /ə'prəʊpriət/. The verb is pronounced /ə'prəʊprieɪt/. 形容词读作/ə'prəʊpriət/，动词读作/ə'prəʊprieɪt/。

value.def: Something that is appropriate is suitable or acceptable for a particular situation.

example.ex: It is appropriate that Irish names dominate the list...
example.tran: 名单上大部分是爱尔兰名字，这没什么不合适的。

example.ex: Dress neatly and attractively in an outfit appropriate to the job...
example.tran: 着装要整洁美观，适合于这份工作。

example.ex: The teacher can then take appropriate action.
example.tran: 老师到时可以采取适当的行动。

gramarinfo.label: oft <l>it</l> v-link ADJ that/to-inf, ADJ <l>for/to</l> n

example.ex: Dress appropriately and ask intelligent questions...
example.tran: 穿着要得体，提问要机敏。

example.ex: It's entitled, appropriately enough, 'Art for the Nation'.
example.tran: 它被恰如其分地取名为“为了国家的艺术”。

example.ex: He wonders about the appropriateness of each move he makes.
example.tran: 他对自己的每次行动都再三思量是否合适。

value.def: If someone appropriates something which does not belong to them, they take it, usually without the right to do so.

example.ex: Several other newspapers have appropriated the idea...
example.tran: 另外有几家报社已盗用了这个创意。

example.ex: The land was simply appropriated by the rulers.
example.tran: 土地完全被统治者霸占。

value.def: If a government or organization appropriates an amount of money for a particular purpose, it reserves it for that purpose.

example.ex: Senator Lugar is skeptical that Congress will appropriate more funding for this purpose.
example.tran: 参议员卢格怀疑国会是否会拨出更多资金用于此目的。

trans: 适当；视情况而定；酌情；适当时；视情况
适当的权限；有关的机构；有关（主管）当局

rootsaffixes.indicate: = own, to own 自己的；拥有 , 引申为“恰当的”
rootsaffixes.title: prop(ri)

partsOfSpeech.dec: ap 加强 + propri 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + ate 做，造成，使… → 强行拥有〔公物〕→ 挪用
ex 除去 + propri 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + ate 做，造成，使… → 不再拥有 → 没收
im 不 + proper 正确的，适当的 → 不适当的
prop 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + er → 自己拿自己的当然是适当的 → 适当的
prop 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + er 表名词 + ty 表状态 → 财产；特性
propri 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + et + or 表人 → 拥有者 → 所有者
propri 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + et + ory …的 → 私有的
propri 自己的；拥有，引申为“恰当的” + ety 表状态 → 适当；礼节
